nl.utwente.iapc.IAPConnect4.server

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • nl.utwente.iapc.IAPConnect4.server.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    ClientHandler Handles the communication between the client and the Server. It enables the server to see a Client's prescence, and eventually assign it a Game.
    Author:
    martijn

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientHandler

        public ClientHandler(java.net.Socket sockArg,
                     Server serverArg)
        ClientHandler handles all commands coming from a Client in a separate Thread and interacts with it. It can have a Game assigned to it by the Server, which is used to play a game. This constructor creates a BufferedReader and BufferedWriter, or enables exit. One may actually start communications by starting this Thread with start().
        Parameters:
        sockArg - Socket belonging to the Client.
        serverArg - The server from which this ClientHandler was invoked, used to communicate with the Server for starting games etc.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts this server by letting the Client log in in with login() and then continuously invoking parseCommand until exit is true.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • newGame

        public void newGame(Game gameArg)
        Register the Game the client is a player of. This can be called to do moves on.
        Parameters:
        gameArg - Game the player is a part of.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Removes the Game from this Player, since it has ended. Unsets the ready state for this Client.

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(Command c)
        Send a Command to the Client associated with this ClientHandler.
        Parameters:
        c - Command to send.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Getter for the ready state of the Client.
        Returns:
        whether the player is ready to play a new Game

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connection with the Client, disassociating all resources associated with this Client, gracefully ending an eventual Game the Client is part of, and subtly closing the connection. It also orders the Server to remove this ClientHandler from the list of ClientHandlers, effectively unlinking this Object.

      • getReader

        public java.io.BufferedReader getReader()
        Getter for the Reader, JML.
        Returns:
        Reader

        Returns:
        Writer

      • isExit

        public boolean isExit()
        Returns whether the client will exit, leading to a closeConnection() invocation. JML
        Returns:
        whether the ClientHandler is in the exit state.
